Transcription for 547607

When I survey the wondrous cross,
On which the Prince of Glory died,
My riches gained, my comfort lost,
And for contempt alone I cried.
For it, Lord, that I should boast,
Save in the cross of Christ my God,
All the great things that God bemost,
I sacrifice them to his blood.
See from his head his heaven and his feet,
Sorrow and love from mayors of the ground,
This at last, and sorrow meet,
All the forms come forth so rich at ground.
O'er the whole realm of nature whine,
That where there are great ones to scold,
Love so amazing, so divine,
Demands my soul, my life, my heart.
